body:
+1

It's awesome work. Ship it. Please add some description for EmptyTuple in the EmptyTuple class before committing.
You seem to intend to submit it to hbase_storage branch rather than master branch, but this pull request was submitted to master.
Sorry for using wrong branch name. I'll close this request and request again.

+1 

The patch looks good to me. I also tested WEB UI. It works well.

Aside from this issue, non-forward queries do not work. We need to fix it.

+1

The patch looks nice to me. I checked the history list and task details in web UI. They work well.

It has a trivial conflict in pom.xml, but I could merge easily the patch to the latest revision. I also verified 'mvn clean install'.

The work is excellent. Here is my +1. I'll commit the patch if there is no objection by today.

+1 
The fix looks straightforward and the unit tests are enough to valid the fix.
@hyunsik Thanks. I had just committed.
I had just committed.
When I rebasing this commit, it also add other commits which are not related to this issue. I'm sorry for this interruption. I will close and re-open again.
I'll commit it shortly.
It would be great if you change the pull request title to more descriptive title :)

Excellent! Here is my +1.

I've just tested the patch on PostgreSQL and Derby. It works well, and the patch looks nice to me. I'll commit the patch to master branch if there is no objection until tomorrow.

FYI, this pull request continues to the following pull requests.
- https://github.com/apache/tajo/pull/216
- https://github.com/apache/tajo/pull/201

Thanks for your good suggestion. 
I changed the title.

+1

The patch looks good to me. This work will be helpful to efficiently manage direct memory in JVM. Could you add one comment to the source before committing the patch?
The patch looks good to me, but needs to be updated against the master branch.

Hi @jihoonson,

I'm still reviewing the patch. I'll ping you when I finish the review.

Actually, I don't know why TravisCI shows errors. But, in my machine, all unit tests are passed.

Could anyone review this?

Hi @blrunner,

I think this fix should be included in 0.9.1. How do you think about that?
Could you rebase it against the latest patch?

I experienced the similar problem in TAJO-838.
In my case, the problem was caused by hcatalog, but you seem to have already solved it.
I hope that it will be an error of Travis CI.
Anyway, I'll review it.

Hi @ykrips,

Could you close this issue? I included #201 instead of #236 in the commit log (https://github.com/apache/tajo/commit/005556850e60f14d5e11ca74035b195461f31d29). The number plays a role to automatically close the corresponding pull request.

Thanks in advance.

Hi @hyunsik,

No problems. I will close this issue.

Guys, It seems to the travis-ci log reached 10000 line
How do you think about that to change the BlockStateChange LOG_LEVEL?

```
10000 2014-11-11 10:09:46,694 INFO: BlockStateChange (logAddStoredBlock(2383)) - BLOCK* addStoredBlock: blockMap updated: 127.0.0.1:38235 is added to blk_1073744739_3915{blockUCState=UNDER_CONSTRUCTION, primaryNodeIndex=-1, replicas=[ReplicaUnderConstruction[[DISK]DS-e2b936fe-902d-46ea-8d42-f485a6b18a93:NORMAL|RBW]]} size 0
```

@jinossy 

That's good idea.
I just rebase.

+1. 
The patch looks good to me.
I left only one trivial comment. You can reflect it before committing if you agree.

+1

The patch looks great to me. This work will remove the unnecessary overheads of byte-array allocation, and it will be very helpful for zero-copy tuple in on-going `block_iteration` works.

Hi @hyunsik 

NP... I'll add more unit test cases by tomorrow night. :)

+1.
This patch looks good to me!

This is awesome work! This feature will make Tajo much better in various workloads and use cases.

I leave comments. In addition, the patch contains not few unused imports. Please remove out them.

This is a result of performance test.
- Data: synthetic data
  - Size: 74.4GB
  - # of rows: 357913940
  - DDL
  - create external table gen2 (id int4, sel_0_001 int4, sel_0_01 int4, sel_0_1 int4, sel_1 int4, sel_5 int4, sel_10 int4, sel_20 int4, f1 text, f2 text, f3 text, f4 text, f5 text, f6 text, f7 text, f8 text, f9 text, f10 text, f11 text, pad text) USING CSV WITH ('csvfile.delimiter'=',') LOCATION '/gen/50g_2';
  - The sel_0_001, sel_0_01, sel_0_1, sel_1, sel_5, sel_10, and sel_20 columns have 0.001, 0.01, 0.1, 1, 5, 10, and 20% selectivities, respectively.
- Query: select id from gen2 where $col = 1;
  - $col: sel_0_001, sel_0_01, sel_0_1, sel_1, sel_5, sel_10, sel_20
- Result
  - Creation time (sec)

| Index name | Time |
| :-: | :-: |
| sel_0_001 | 159.237 |
| sel_0_01 | 137.716 |
| sel_0_1 | 135.772 |
| sel_1 | 121.511 |
| sel_5 | 124.585 |
| sel_10 | 123.593 |
| sel_20 | 120.621 |
- Query execution time (sec)

| $col | Seq scan | Index scan |
| :-: | :-: | :-: |
| sel_0_001 | 67.681 | 8.445 |
| sel_0_01 | 75.628 | 16.306 |
| sel_0_1 | 74.602 | 54.602 |
| sel_1 | 78.056 | 98.552 |
| sel_5 | 69.755 | 104.018 |
| sel_10 | 81.483 | 117.401 |
| sel_20 | 71.334 | 103.993 |
I'll rebase the patch soon.

Hyunsik, sorry for late response.
I forgot to reflect your comment. 
I'll update my patch.
@hyunsik Thanks for your review. I pushed the fetch which is applied your comment.
Excellent! Here is my +1 for pushing the patch to `hbase_storage` branch.

+1
The fix looks straightforward.
Thank you for your quick review. Probably, your time is 3 AM. Have a good night!
@charsyam Could you close this issue? I missed to add 'close command' in the commit log. Thank you for your contribution.

+1
The patch looks good to me.

Hi @hyunsik 

I added a unit test case to verify ResultSet.
Could you check the patch again?

TravisCI causes the following compilation errors. Could you check it?

```
[ERROR] The build could not read 2 projects -> [Help 1]
[ERROR]   
[ERROR]   The project org.apache.tajo:tajo-core:0.9.1-SNAPSHOT (/home/travis/build/apache/tajo/tajo-core/pom.xml) has 1 error
[ERROR]     'dependencies.dependency.version' for org.apache.tajo:tajo-hcatalog:jar is missing. @ org.apache.tajo:tajo-core:[unknown-version], /home/travis/build/apache/tajo/tajo-core/pom.xml, line 491, column 21
[ERROR]   
[ERROR]   The project org.apache.tajo:tajo-hcatalog:0.9.1-SNAPSHOT (/home/travis/build/apache/tajo/tajo-catalog/tajo-catalog-drivers/tajo-hcatalog/pom.xml) has 1 error
[ERROR]     'dependencies.dependency.version' for org.apache.tajo:tajo-storage:jar is missing. @ org.apache.tajo:tajo-hcatalog:[unknown-version], /home/travis/build/apache/tajo/tajo-catalog/tajo-catalog-drivers/tajo-hcatalog/pom.xml, line 114, column 17

```

TravisCI causes the following error. Could you check it? or could you submit the patch to jira and trigger the jenkins unit test?

```
Results :
Failed tests: 
  TestJoinQuery.testOuterJoinAndCaseWhen1:314->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:544->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:572 Table [table1] creation is failed.
  TestJoinQuery.testOuterJoinAndCaseWhen1:314->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:544->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:572 Table [table1] creation is failed.
  TestJoinQuery.testOuterJoinAndCaseWhen1:314->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:544->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:572 Table [table1] creation is failed.
  TestJoinQuery.testOuterJoinAndCaseWhen1:314->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:544->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:572 Table [table1] creation is failed.
  TestSortQuery.testSortWithDate:134->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:544->QueryTestCaseBase.executeDDL:572 Table [table1] creation is failed.
```

Sorry I fixed adding tajo-hcatalog version to tajo-core/pom.xml and changing tajo-storage to tajo-storage-common in tajo-hcatalog/pom.xml. But I don't know exactly why tajo-core/pom.xml need to add a hcatalog version.
@babokim Could you close this issue? The 'ticket close' command in git commit log seems to work in only `master` branch.

+1

The patch looks good to me. It's nice work.

TravisCI shows the compilation error. I may be caused by the log size limit. I fixed the problem in #245. I manually verified 'mvn clean install'. I passed all unit tests.

Hi @hyunsik 

I fixed a bug. The Travis CI build will build successfully tonight.
Thank you for your contribution. I'll review the patch soon.
`STORED AS elasticsearch` seems to be a typo error. You may intend `USING elasticsearch`.
Thanks @hyunsik. I've just fixed it. :)
I have one more suggestion. If you possible, could you replace current javascript alert message to "Query execution failed" at query_executor.jsp?

Hi @charsyam 

+1

Thanks for your contribution.
I'll push it to the master branch.

Cheers
Jaehwa

It seems to be committed to master branch. 

@charsyam could you close this issue?

Awesome work!
But, your patch seems to include another commit (TAJO-1195).
Would you check it, please?

@jinossy ok. I missed it.
+1!

I found that commit logs are mixed with another patch.
I'll create another request.

+1
I also found this bug while I'm testing Tajo on Slider. It seems to be an urgent issue. The patch looks good to me. Ship it!

++1

Excellent work! The newly added unit tests verify all cases.

+1

It looks good to me and all unit test cases passed successfully.
Push it. :)
That's great. Your suggestion would give better user experience on web gui. I will commit it in a short time.

As I mentioned, I replaced S3FileSystem to LocalFileSystem for unit test. But in this case, we can't test split size because of result data size is less than HDFS default block size. So, I added "fs.local.block.size" to storage-site.xml for unit test. I found that this branch build had succeed on  hadoop-2.5.1 and hadoop-2.6.0-SNAPSHOT.

For reference, I also tested some TPC-H  queries on a real cluster. 
In addition, all test has passed successfully.

Hi @charsyam 

Thanks for your contribution. I've tried to find usages of ServerName class.
But it just is used to unit test case. And current tajo use WorkerConnectionInfo instead of ServerName. To my regret, if possible, could you remove ServerName and TestServerName?

Cheers
Jaehwa

Hi. @blrunner 
I will remove ServerName and TestServerName ASAP

+1 

This work allows TajoMaster to use the persistent history instead of HashMap. The patch looks good to me.

+1

This fix is reasonable. The test should be tested with UTC.

Thanks @hyunsik .
I've just updated it. :)

+1

Thanks @ykrips .
I've just found that it worked on my testing cluster.
I'm going to push it to the master branch for now.

+1
Thanks @charsyam.
I'll push it. :)

+1

Thanks for your contribution. All unit test cases passed successfully.
Push it.:)
I'm sorry for late review. Could you rebase it?
+1 ship it!

Hi,

I'm sorry for late review. I'll finish its review by today.

Hi @ykrips 

Could you close this issue? :)
@hyunsik , thanks for quick review. :)

The patch looks good to me. I'd like to suggest two things.
- One is long option which is more descriptive. For example, it would be great if the script provides `--tar` (`-t`), `--conf` (`-c`), and `--lib` (`-l`) .
- The second is more modularization. Currently, multiple steps are a sequence of routines. Could you modularize them into multiple pieces of functions?

No problem.
Please take it slow. :)
As I also mentioned in the jira (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TAJO-1122), I agree with the package hierarchy. I leave some comments. They are mostly trivial things.

+1

Ship it. The patch looks good to me.

Hi @charsyam,

I just committed. But, I missed to include the github command 'closes #249', which forces github to automatically close this ticket. Could you close manually this issue?
committed.

@hyunsik 
Thanks for detail review. I just rebased and fixed all that you commented.

+1

the patch looks good to me. Ship it!
Since the jira issue number (Tajo-838) in the github issue title includes lower case, this github ticket is not linked to the jira. So, could you change the jira issue number to upper case?
I leave comments. In overall, the patch looks good to me. But, some parts seem to need documentation, especially in changed interfaces.

See the description in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TAJO-1209.

I keep the existing CSVFile class because TAJO-838 needs CSVFile which is a seekable scanner.

@blrunner 
Could you add comment to record that we borrow this class from YARN? It would be useful for other guys to maintain the code in the future.

Hi @jinossy 

Thanks for your review. I added a comment to indicate the source for yarn and I fixed a few document bugs.
I've updated the patch.

+1 Looks good to me.
Ship it!

+1 
looks good to me.
committed.

Thanks @hyunsik.
I've just committed it to master branch.
I rebased and reflected your comments. Also, I changed the patch to use the pluggable text line serde (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TAJO-1209) which has been recently added.
updated.
